reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would recommend this game over other poker games. This is not my poker account, if the time played seems low. I have put over 80 hours into this game so far.

+ No pay to win aspect.
+ They do not bother you with any sort of ads or interruptions. Just poker.
+ The character motion system is unique and adds another layer to the game. If you need to check your hand, your character shows you doing it. If you say way ahead of time that you will be folding, other players can look at your character and see her getting ready to fold. If you mouse over Call when it is your turn, opponents see your character's hand start to reach for their chips. All of these elements make it feel much more immersive.
+ The AI for the singleplayer are not brain dead. They also feel as if they have distinct personalities. Try to beat the same table multiple times, you will start to notice those personalities. They aren't just different skins on the same AI.
+ The game allows off the cuff tournament style tables to be formed. Many poker games only allow tournament style games for their own sponsored tournaments. Here, you can just join one with other players. This is a great function.
+ A bunch of fun cosmetic stuff like clothing you can unlock and buy with chips. This may seem silly to some, but other players will spend hours staring at my character. I like being able to customize her.
+ Tables are in rooms that give the actual feel of environment. Not the abstract top down view with disembodied cards that a lot of poker games have.
+ The devs are very involved and communicate with the community. They also play the game and have an interest in poker. It isn't just a product for them.
+ There are underground affiliations to associate with, unlock unique clothing and other identifiers with that group. The future possibilities for different players associated with different gangs leaves a lot of future content to be released.

- The only negative I can think of is that at certain times of the day it can be hard to find high buy-in tables. Low and mid tables always have people, but sometimes the more expensive tables can feel a little empty if you are on at weird times. I assume this will change as more people gain chips and can afford the higher tables.

Features

There's multiplayer, cosmetics to spend your winnings on, single player, friends versus mode, leader board, VOiP while playing the game, avatar character customization and more. There's Texas Hold'em. Chip stacks change in size when you lose or gain chips, making it visually possible to compare earnings.

Multiplayer

You can play other random people on the internet. You can play with friends but it's limited to versus mode with friends only. Winnings and earns are persistent. Finding a game is fast when using a 1000 chip buy in. Character names allow internet address which would be intersting to those who want to use Twitch or advertise a website. Direct player trading isn't allowed but play with your friend a private 1v1 game, go all in on a losing hand and you've just trade your friend chips. You can gift" your friend clothes and items you've bought with chips.

This is an amazing poker game, with a lot of potential!

As a disliker of most early access games (usually just means it's always broken), this game is actually quite functional right off the bat.

It of course has some optimization issues, most early access games seem to need a mid-grade gaming rig at least to run. This one does have a very low setting, and it runs off the Unreal Engine, which is pretty optimized in itself.

My critisism is as follows:
-needs more options available for fine tuning the graphics
-more options for changing the controls, let us bind keys to the keyboard!
-pacing could be a little faster
-when you pick an option before it is your turn, your hands sit in an obvious position. Everyone knows what you're about to do (check, fold, call etc.). This is obviously a problem

All in all though, this is well put together and I've already put some hours into it. Hope this goes somewhere and I'm excited for ranked!
